results.title: Coaches
results.creator_credit: Paul Cowan, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Coaches is about four people preparing their teams for the Pre-Olympics. Their distinctive approaches emerge during the fights, the good times, and those critical post-game sessions when feelings are raw or jubilant. It is a film about human growth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Cowan, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Coffee and cigarettes
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, Jason Kliot, Joana Vicente and Smokescreen
results.brief_description: Coffee and cigarettes are often seen as an aid to facilitating conversation. Made of up eleven small stories, shot in B&W, starring famous faces from the stage and screen we witness some of these conversations. Ordinary, bizarre, whimsical - conversations about a great number of topics, all take place whilst imbibing a hot coffee and dragging on a ciggie. Cast includes Roberto Benigni, Steven Wright, Joie Lee, Cinque Lee, Steve Buscemi, Iggy Pop, Tom Waits, Joe Rigano, Vinny Vella, Vinny Vella Jr, Renne French, E. J. Rodriguerz, Alex Descas, Isaach de Bankole, Cate Blanchett, Meg White, Jack White, Alfred Molina, Steve Coogan, Gza, Rza, Bill Murray, Bill Rice, Taylor Mead.

results.title: Coerver coaching method. Vol. 3
results.brief_description: Wiel Coerver, renowned Dutch soccer champion teaches a comprehensive range of soccer skills. Volume 3 of this three-part collection includes the following playing techniques: one on two combination, overlapping, crosses and through passes, heading, shooting.
results.description: Wiel Coerver, renowned Dutch soccer champion teaches a comprehensive range of soccer skills. Volume 3 of this three-part collection includes the following playing techniques: one on two combination, overlapping, crosses and through passes, heading, shooting.

results.title: Coerver coaching method. Vol. 2.
results.brief_description: Wiel Coerver, renowned Dutch soccer champion teaches a comprehensive range of soccer skills. Volume 2 of this three-part collection includes the following playing techniques: moves to beat an opponent, one on one, fakes, moves to get past opponents.

results.title: Clowning around 2
results.creator_credit: Julie Morton, Paul D. Barron, George Whaley and Barron Films
results.brief_description: Simon “Sim” Gunner continues his journey in order to fulfill his dream of becoming a circus clown. Sim’s first job is as a junior “Carpet clown” in Paris but soon he finds himself in the Cirque De La Luna in Montreal. Eventually his clowning adventures take him back home to Australia where his ambitions come true.

results.title: Clowning around
results.creator_credit: Antonia Barnard, Paul D. Barron, George Whaley and Barron Films
results.brief_description: The story of a boy with a special dream and a teacher with a painful past. Simon Gunner dreams of being a clown; not just an ordinary clown, but a clown in a circus. This story is filled with wonderful characters and colourful settings and stars Clayton Williamson, Noni Hazelhurst, Ernie Dingo and Jean-Michael Dagory in a family adventure

results.title: Cloud over the coral reef
results.creator_credit: Lee Tepley, R.E. Johannes and Moonlight Productions
results.brief_description: This film considers the effect of sewage pollution and sedimentation on the coral reefs of the tropics and also examines a severe ecological disturbance of unknown origin - the population explosion of the coral eating Crown of Thorns starfish, which may be caused by pollution or some other form of man’s activity.

results.title: Cloud over Ohio
results.creator_credit: Edward Plumb, Karl Maslowski and S O H I O
results.brief_description: In spite of a high annual rainfall, the state of Ohio, USA has faced severe droughts. This film illustrates the part played by water in the daily lives of the inhabitants, also its use in industry and agriculture, then probes for reasons behind the apparent wastage of water resources. Draws particular attention to wastage of both soil and water resulting from soil erosion. Includes close-up shots of rain drops striking unprotected soil, showing the extent and nature of the damage caused.

results.title: Clothing. - 3rd ed.
results.creator_credit: Hermann D. Tauchert and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film combines animation and live-action to outline the variety and purpose of clothing. The development of fabrics from the early use of grasses, leaves, skins and furs is followed by scenes from early film clips showing industrialisation in textile-making and the manufacturing of synthetic fibres and cloth. Includes footage showing the mass production of jeans (Levi Strauss). Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Clotheslines
results.brief_description: A poetic documentary which focuses on laundry as an aspect of women’s lives and work in the home. The film is composed largely of tales and memories, and through the acts of hanging, folding, arranging, ironing and placing laundry in drawers, “Clotheslines” demonstrates how these have become symbolic actions for mothering, living properly and, most of all, providing a sense of security.
